text: many of you asked me how I got started
traveling and making a living abroad so
I thought I would share with you my life
story from the beginning I was born in
Dallas Texas but grew up in the hot
desert of Phoenix Arizona I've always
been a huge sports fan and athlete
playing baseball and competitive hockey
as a kid and now I'm a six handicap
golfer growing up I traveled quite a bit
in the States for hockey tournaments and
family trips I had been to about 20
states before I was 15 but never
overseas I first got interested in
traveling after my parents got me this
globe for my 10th birthday every night
before I went to bed I would spin the
globe and memorize every country in
capital when it was time for college I
wanted to get out of Arizona so I moved
1,700 miles across the country to attend
the University of wisconsin-madison
I arrived in medicine without knowing a
single person or owning a winter jacket
and I left with several best friends
after the best four years of my life
during my junior year I studied abroad
in Prague it was my first time abroad
and I was hooked and my eyes were opened
up to new culture I visited about 20
countries in Europe that semester and it
was at that point when I knew I wanted
to make a career out of traveling after
Prague I went back to Wisconsin to
finish my last year of college I
graduated with a double major in
economics and entrepreneurship in May
2013 instead of applying for a corporate
job like society was telling me I wanted
to follow my heart I heard about
teaching English in Korea and the very
next day I sent in my application three
months as a fresh college grad I moved
to a village near Seoul to become an
English teacher for 18 months it was my
first time in Asia and my first time
standing in front of a classroom but I
instantly fell in love with the culture
food and lifestyle around me from day
one in Korea I started a travel blog
called the hungry partier and committed
myself to grow a global audience I
worked my butt off spending every second
of my free time writing networking and
building up my social media channel
while living in Korea I visited 22 Asian
countries got a black belt in Taekwondo
and nearly became fluent in Korean I
left Seoul in March 2015 and was making
enough money from my blog to cover about
half of my travel expenses so that's
exactly what I did travel I went on a
solo backpacking trip across India for
three months covering 2,200 miles
it was both challenging and enriching
and I learned more about myself in those
3 months and any other trip my office
turned into coffee shops and I slowly
picked up more sponsors from travel
brands and company again this came as a
result of very hard work and learning
how to
myself on March 3rd 2015 while sitting
at this table in Jessamine India I
realized that girl following on snapchat
and uses to promote my travel I got a
head start on the platform before many
travel brands and influencers joined so
I ran with it
after India I kept traveling and
snapchatting my way around the world in
2016 I visited 39 new countries across
Europe Asia Australia New Zealand the
South Pacific and South America in July
2016 I launched my new travel blog
called Drew Pinsky calm and focused on
growing my personal brand as drew Binh
ski because the name hungry partner was
a bad reflection of the person I truly
am in January 2017 I moved to Hanoi with
my girlfriend and transitioned as a
content creator when she bought me my
first canon video camera I started
focusing on making short videos from my
travel and posting them on Facebook not
YouTube for reasons I'll discuss in
another video I'm planning to continue
traveling and making videos because I
really do enjoy it I love meeting new
people eating new foods and learning
about new cultures I'm hoping to visit
every country before turning 30 and 2021
only 89 countries to go lastly my number
one goal with everything is to inspire
people to travel and I strive to be an
influencer and a resource to help you
along the way
so if you're watching this I want to say
thank you so much you guys keep me going
and I really enjoy answering all of your
questions please comment on this video
and tell me your story or ask me a
question and I'll answer you
[Music]
